culturalContext.description: This phrase features "ru" - lullaby - mothers singing to children. The exclamatory form adds emotional emphasis, common in Vietnamese folk music to engage listeners. Lullabies sung by mothers across all regions of Vietnam.
facts: Each region has distinct lullaby styles with local characteristics
Often express mothers' hopes, worries, and love for children
Vietnamese folk songs preserve oral traditions passed down through generations without written notation
Dan Tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are relatively modern adaptations of vocal traditions
culturalContext.musicalContext: This exclamatory phrase contains 5 syllables, slightly longer than the typical 4-syllable pattern, adding emphasis or conclusion. As an exclamatory phrase, it likely features sustained notes or ascending contours for emotional expression. Soft, repetitive melodies with gentle rocking rhythm.
